content:
• Thursday, September 6, 2012
  • ARAY

    More on Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY): FQ4 misses on both top and bottom line estimates on nearly an 8%...

    More on Accuray (NASDAQ:ARAY): FQ4 misses on both top and bottom line estimates on nearly an 8% drop in total revenue Y/Y. CyberKnife System revenues sipped due to shipment schedules in the European region and a decline in new orders in the Americas region, offset partially by increases in the Asia Pacific and Japan regions. Shares -12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • STI

    SunTrust (NYSE:STI) moves to shore up its balance sheet by selling its stake in Coca-Cola...

    SunTrust (NYSE:STI) moves to shore up its balance sheet by selling its stake in Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO), generating a $1.9B pre-tax gain. The bank will record about $375M in mortgage repurchase provisions during Q3, increasing mortgage repurchase reserves to levels sufficient to cover the remaining loan demands sold to GSE's prior to 2009. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • ET-OLD

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) -3.2% AH after announcing insiders plan to unload 6.5M shares (nearly...

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) -3.2% AH after announcing insiders plan to unload 6.5M shares (nearly 10% of all outstanding shares) through a public offering. ExactTarget, which floated 8.5M shares during its March IPO, will see its lockup expire on Sep. 17.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • ULTA

    More on Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q2 beats across the board on a 22% jump in total sales. Net...

    More on Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q2 beats across the board on a 22% jump in total sales. Net earnings rose 46%, as the beauty-products retailer's bottom line benefited from continued expansion and strong same-store sales. The company opened 22 new stores during the quarter, ending with 489. Square footage was up 18% from a year earlier. Shares +8.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • MFRM

    More on Mattress Firm's FQ2: Same-store sales growth of 5% a major slowdown from FQ1's 16.1%....

    More on Mattress Firm's FQ2: Same-store sales growth of 5% a major slowdown from FQ1's 16.1%. MFRM is acquiring Mattress X-Press, owner of 35 mattress stores in South Carolina and Georgia, for $15.8M. Mattress X-Press is expected to add $7M-$9M to 2H FY13 revenue; reduce FY13 EPS by $0.03-$0.04, and increase FY14 EPS by $0.09-$0.12. The company expects FY13 revenue of $1.022B-$1.039B and EPS of $1.47-$1.50 vs. a consensus of $1.02B and $1.49. MFRM -12.1% AH. TPX -2.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AOBC

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): Shares are soaring in after hours trade as its FQ1 blows away...

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): Shares are soaring in after hours trade as its FQ1 blows away estimates on a 48% jump in Y/Y total revenue. Gross margin widened to 37.7% from 28.9%, despite a 30% jump in input costs, thanks to cost-cutting efforts and higher sales of its polymer firearms. The company also boosted its guidance for the year, now forecasting $0.85 to $0.90 per share on net sales of $530M to $540M. Shares +21% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • COO

    More on Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ3 easily beats across the board as its bottom line soars....

    More on Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ3 easily beats across the board as its bottom line soars. Total revenue rose 8% Y/Y on strength in its CooperVision and CooperSurgical divisions, while net earnings were boosted by margin gains across virtually all units. The company also guides its FY higher, now expecting its EPS to be between $4.90 -$5.15 on revenue of $1.44B - $1.55B. Shares +7.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • ENVI

    Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI): Q2 EPS of -$0.13 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $10.8M (-6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI): Q2 EPS of -$0.13 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $10.8M (-6% Y/Y) beats by $0.15M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • BLOX

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX): FQ4 EPS of $0.01 in-line. Revenue of $45.1M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $1.6M....

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX): FQ4 EPS of $0.01 in-line. Revenue of $45.1M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $1.6M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ADNC

    Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC) -35.3% AH after warning the iPhone 5 won't contain its voice...

    Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC) -35.3% AH after warning the iPhone 5 won't contain its voice signal-processing tech, which is designed into the iPhone 4S (and yields a per-unit royalty). Audience nonetheless expects Q3 revenue of $35M-$38M and EPS of $0.11-$0.15, mostly above a consensus of $34.7M and $0.11, thanks to the strength of existing hardware shipments (the Galaxy S III is probably helping). But it's safe to assume declining Apple royalties will take a toll on future quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ1 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $35.7M (+61% Y/Y)...

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ1 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $35.7M (+61% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ3 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $378.2M (+8% Y/Y) beats...

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ3 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $378.2M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $262M (+45.6% Y/Y)...

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $262M (+45.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -11.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.03. Revenue of...

    Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $481.7M (+22% Y/Y)beats by $8M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • LNCE

    Snyders-Lance (LNCE +11.7%) spiked higher after last night's announced acquisition of Snack...

    Snyders-Lance (LNCE +11.7%) spiked higher after last night's announced acquisition of Snack Factory and certain affiliates for $340M in cash, adding the fast-expanding Pretzel Crisps brand to the snack company's portfolio. The deal is expected to close early in Q4 and will add ~$0.02 to adjusted EPS in 2012 and ~$0.10 in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • OREX

    Shares of Orexigen (OREX +16.7%) are soaring after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an...

    Shares of Orexigen (OREX +16.7%) are soaring after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an Outperform, saying it likes the prospects of a trial that will look at the cardiovascular impact of Contrave. Leerink Swann also recommends investors buy it aggressively. Meanwhile, it starts Arena Pharmaceutical (ARNA -4.6%) with an Underperform , saying Belviq may not generate enough revenue to justify the stock's current valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 22 Comments
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI +8.9%) tops the S&P 500 after CFO Stephen Bramlage backs its Q3 outlook...

    Owens-Illinois (OI +8.9%) tops the S&P 500 after CFO Stephen Bramlage backs its Q3 outlook despite tough market conditions, which takes on added significance since OI draws ~40% of its annual sales from Europe. The glass container company also recently reported a favorable ruling in an asbestos case and plans to buy back up to $75M of its shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • PWER

    A wild and strange ride today for Power-One (PWER -8.1%), whose shares briefly spiked on an...

    A wild and strange ride today for Power-One (PWER -8.1%), whose shares briefly spiked on an FT Alphaville blog suggesting the solar firm is actively trying to sell itself, then promptly tanking nearly 10%. The post also indicated general analyst sentiment is that PWER “will struggle to crack promising markets in Asia, while its core source of revenue to date - Europe - has gone scarily ex-growth.”

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • PWER

    Goldman Sachs appears to be actively seeking a buyer for struggling power conversion and...

    Goldman Sachs appears to be actively seeking a buyer for struggling power conversion and management company Power One (PWER -8.8%). The founders of the company reportedly turned down two offers for the company last year from Schneider Electric (OTCPK:SBGSY) and GE, at prices substantially above the current market value. Other suitors potentially include Panasonic, as well as China’s GCL-Poly Energy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +10.2%) soars after shares are upgraded to Buy with an $8 price target at Longbow...

    AK Steel (AKS +10.2%) soars after shares are upgraded to Buy with an $8 price target at Longbow Research, which cites the pullback in prices for iron ore and metallurgical coal that should boost margins and the company's risk/reward profile. The firm notes AKS is reliant on the merchant market for nearly all of its primary raw materials.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian (HOV -3.5%) slips today despite beating on its FQ3 bottom line, as revenue disappoints...

    Hovnanian (HOV -3.5%) slips today despite beating on its FQ3 bottom line, as revenue disappoints on the whisper number. Total sales jumped 35% Y/Y, as the home builder saw double-digit revenue growth and an increase in net contracts, the latest sign of improvement in the housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • SFLY

    Barclays keeps an Overweight rating on Shutterfly (SFLY +8.1%) locked in place after sizing up...

    Barclays keeps an Overweight rating on Shutterfly (SFLY +8.1%) locked in place after sizing up management's vision in a meet-and-greet. New areas of growth and synergies from the purchase of Kodak Gallery should kick in before the end of the year. With a price target of $42, Barclays sees plenty of upside potential even after today's run.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • GENE

    Australian diagnostic firm Genetic Technologies (GENE +6%) spikes higher after signing a license...

    Australian diagnostic firm Genetic Technologies (GENE +6%) spikes higher after signing a license agreement with Conexio Genomics. Under the terms of the agreement, Conexio will be granted non-exclusive rights to a number of GENE patents relating to its non-coding DNA technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +1%) shows resilience today on the back of overall sector...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +1%) shows resilience today on the back of overall sector strength, bucking a downgrade at UBS from Buy to Neutral and a price target cut from $58 to $35. The firm says it sees a risk to dividends due to plummeting iron ore prices. Unless spot prices improve, UBS will need to cut its dividend to avoid breaching covenants.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +2.9%) rack up another gain to threaten the $70 level for the first...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +2.9%) rack up another gain to threaten the $70 level for the first time since early June. Tomorrow morning the company reports earnings, an event which typically drives up activity on the heavily-shorted name more than a normal stock. (earnings preview)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -18.8%) may be suffering from flash memory shortages, but its FQ2 warning...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -18.8%) may be suffering from flash memory shortages, but its FQ2 warning also speaks of execution and supply-chain problems, thinks Needham, which is downgrading the solid-state drive (SSD) vendor. FBN is also downgrading, arguing competition and soft demand are taking a toll. Pac Crest, meanwhile, thinks flash constraints will give manufacturers such as SanDisk (SNDK +8.1%) a chance to gain SSD share in the high-margin enterprise segment. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRGO

    Perrigo (PRGO +1.6%) files an Abbreviated New Drug Application with the FDA for albuterol...

    Perrigo (PRGO +1.6%) files an Abbreviated New Drug Application with the FDA for albuterol sulfate HFA inhalation aerosol, a generic version of Teva Pharmaceutical's (TEVA +1%) ProAir HFA. The filing involves contributions from both PRGO and Catalent Pharma Solutions, who partnered on the development. TEVA claims the application violates its patent on the drug, and yesterday it filed suit against both companies in U.S. District Court alleging patent infringement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +3.2%) is bouncing in spite of getting downgraded by Deutsche and SocGen following...

    Nokia (NOK +3.2%) is bouncing in spite of getting downgraded by Deutsche and SocGen following yesterday's Lumia launches. Deutsche forecasts Q4 Lumia shipments of just 4M and 2013 shipments of 25M (less than one quarter of iPhone sales). The firm is worried Windows Phone 8's hardware requirements will prevent Nokia from profitably competing in the sub-$200 smartphone market, where Android has mostly wiped out Symbian, and is rapidly eating into Nokia's feature phone base. (earlier )

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 7 Comments
  • CPRI

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +4.0%) break higher on heavy volume to scratch $55 for the first...

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +4.0%) break higher on heavy volume to scratch $55 for the first time since the company's IPO. CEO John Idol is drawing rave reviews for his presentation at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing Conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +6.3%) gets a bump from Roth Capital this morning, initiating the...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +6.3%) gets a bump from Roth Capital this morning, initiating the shares with a Buy rating and a price target of $15. Yesterday, the company announced it's commenced Phase 2 clinical studies on two of its marquee drug candidates. The first, R343, is an inhaled SYK inhibitor that is being evaluated as a potential treatment for allergic asthma. The second, R333, is a topical JAK/SYK inhibitor aimed at treating various phases of lupus of the skin.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Technology (IDTI +10%) soars after Craig-Hallum starts coverage with a Buy and...

    Integrated Device Technology (IDTI +10%) soars after Craig-Hallum starts coverage with a Buy and $8 target. The diversified chipmaker rallied last week after Intel announced it would be using IDT's wireless charging chipset for a charging solution meant for notebooks and mobile devices.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • MHO

    M/I Homes (MHO +4.4%) pops after pricing its previously announced offering of 2.2M common shares...

    M/I Homes (MHO +4.4%) pops after pricing its previously announced offering of 2.2M common shares at $17.63, an even match to Wednesday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • TNGO

    It's happening again. A week after Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -18%) was hammered by a very critical report...

    It's happening again. A week after Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -18%) was hammered by a very critical report from The Street Sweeper, shares are diving due to an equally bearish report from Copperfield Research. Copperfield argues Tangoe's organic growth is much lower than is often assumed; notes deferred revenue growth is soft; and questions the backgrounds of Tangoe's management and VC investor Edison Ventures.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -12.2%) gets hammered after its FQ3 fell short of estimates yesterday. Net...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -12.2%) gets hammered after its FQ3 fell short of estimates yesterday. Net losses widened as the power-equipment maker's product sales fell 6.2% to $27.6M and expenses increased. Input costs rose 4.5%, while administrative and selling expenses jumped 28%, reflecting market-development activities related to pending power-plant projects in the order pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI +3.7%) outperforms following an upgrade to Overweight from Piper, which is...

    Activision (ATVI +3.7%) outperforms following an upgrade to Overweight from Piper, which is encouraged by a fall game lineup that includes refreshes for the Skylanders, World of Warcraft, and Call of Duty franchises. The firm also thinks Activision has "out-executed peers" as of late, and argues shares are primed to break out of a trading range that dates back to '09. (Vivendi sale efforts)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • XOM

    ExxonMobil (XOM +1.7%) chief Rex Tillerson says its Kara Sea exploration project is running...

    ExxonMobil (XOM +1.7%) chief Rex Tillerson says its Kara Sea exploration project is running ahead of schedule with hopes to kick off drilling at the Arctic play in 2014. Tillerson tells Russian president Putin that XOM and Rosneft would work in "challenging circumstances" seeking to meet the growing global energy demand which he expects to grow by 30% by 2040.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • FACE

    Physicians Formula Holdings (FACE +9.6%) says it's received a $73.1M buyout offer from an...

    Physicians Formula Holdings (FACE +9.6%) says it's received a $73.1M buyout offer from an unnamed party. The offer comes just three weeks after the cosmetics and skin care company agreed to be taken private by private equity firm Swander Pace Capital for around $65M. The new bid is for $4.90 a share, a 33% premium over its closing price on August 14, and 15% higher than Swander Pace's $4.25 a share offer announced on August 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (SWKS +4.8%) pops after UBS lifts its target to $36 from $33. UBS cites the RF...

    Skyworks (SWKS +4.8%) pops after UBS lifts its target to $36 from $33. UBS cites the RF chipmaker's ability to benefit from iPhone 5 sales, 4G adoption (4G phones require more/costlier RF components), 3G growth (still happening in emerging markets), and share gains. Skyworks is also getting a lift from today's rally in chip stocks (SOXX +2.9%). Barclays downgraded shares on valuation grounds on Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AKG

    Keegan Resources (KGN +3.2%) shares jump after the gold miner provides an update on its Essase...

    Keegan Resources (KGN +3.2%) shares jump after the gold miner provides an update on its Essase project in Ghana; preliminary estimates indicate the project's capital costs could be reduced to ~$260M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • MGM

    Casino stocks show outsized gains off of a slew of more positive-sounding economic reports with...

    Casino stocks show outsized gains off of a slew of more positive-sounding economic reports with MGM Resorts (MGM +5.5%) leading the charge. Though the sector typically rallies on a risk-on day, analysts are starting to quibble that the increasing reliance of gaming companies on Maco for revenue gains makes U.S. news less potent. Advancers: LVS +3.4%, MPEL +2.4%, WYNN +2.2%, PNK +2.5%. BYD +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (SIGM -11.1%) tanks following its FQ2 report. Though results beat estimates, the...

    Sigma Designs (SIGM -11.1%) tanks following its FQ2 report. Though results beat estimates, the chipmaker guided on its earnings call for FQ3 revenue of $60M-$64M, well below a $73.5M consensus. Sigma, which is heavily exposed to a weak TV market, says it expects HDTV chip sales to be "relatively flat" Q/Q in Q3, typically its strongest quarter. BWS Financial is downgrading to Hold, arguing Sigma's IPTV processor line (15% of FQ2 sales) is no longer a growth catalyst.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVAV

    Shares of AeroVironment (AVAV -10%) take a hit after missing on its FQ1 earlier this morning....

    Shares of AeroVironment (AVAV -10%) take a hit after missing on its FQ1 earlier this morning. Total revenue fell 5% Y/Y, as sales of its unmanned aircraft slipped. Gross margin narrowed to 33.2% from 35%, as R&D expenses rose 7.3% and its unmanned aircraft revenue shrank 6.5%. The company maintains its view on FY13 however, anticipating net income of $1.41 to $1.51 per share on revenue of $348M to $370M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • RIO

    Despite Rio Tinto's (RIO +4.3%) efforts to put the ill-fated 2007 acquisition of Alcan behind...

    Despite Rio Tinto's (RIO +4.3%) efforts to put the ill-fated 2007 acquisition of Alcan behind it, analysts who met this week with the CFO are convinced another hefty impairment will be needed this year, despite steps taken to slash costs, close unprofitable capacity and sell assets. RIO does say demand remains strong, which paints a healthier long-term picture for aluminum.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • LDK

    Some Chinese solar names are tanking on news of the EU's anti-dumping investigation. LDK -5.3%....

    Some Chinese solar names are tanking on news of the EU's anti-dumping investigation. LDK -5.3%. TSL -3.8%. STP -5.2%. JASO -12.6%. Meanwhile, U.S.-based First Solar (FSLR +2.8%) has added to its premarket gains. The Chinese government, which just sped up an anti-dumping probe aimed at U.S. polysilicon vendors, might also make a retaliatory move against European solar firms.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 3 Comments

  • StemCells ([[STEM] +4.7%) receives a $20M grant from the California Institute for Regenerative...

    StemCells ([[STEM] +4.7%) receives a $20M grant from the California Institute for Regenerative Medicine to help the company develop its HuCNS-SC product for treating Alzheimer's disease. The award comes after recent positive preclinical studies connected to Alzheimer's. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -1.9%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS, which sees a risk to the...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -1.9%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS, which sees a risk to the 7% dividend given the fall in iron ore prices; the target price is also dropped substantially, to $35 from $58. Longbow also downgrades shares to Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • WDC

    When is a customer's earnings warning good for a company's stock? When it's blamed on a shortage...

    When is a customer's earnings warning good for a company's stock? When it's blamed on a shortage that investors view as a sign of strong demand. NAND flash memory suppliers SanDisk (SNDK +6%) and Micron (MU +4.4%) are jumping in response to OCZ Technology's (OCZ -23.3%) FQ2 warning, which was attributed to a NAND shortage. Apple and Samsung are known to be stockpiling huge quantities of NAND, and a recent Toshiba production cut may have been overkill. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +2.2%) show another gain as M&A speculation continues to swirl....

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +2.2%) show another gain as M&A speculation continues to swirl. Names that are going tossed around as buyers include big players such as Microsoft, Oracle, News Corp., and Salesforce.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -4.2%) drops after Needham's Richard Kugele downgrades to Underperform. Kugele's...

    Seagate (STX -4.2%) drops after Needham's Richard Kugele downgrades to Underperform. Kugele's talks with industry players indicate demand is weak notonly for desktop and notebook hard drives (unsurprising), but also for enterprise (server/storage) drives. He's also cutting his PT for Western Digital (WDC -0.4%), but reiterates a Strong Buy due to conservative guidance and the expected benefits of integrating Hitachi's hard drive ops and internally sourcing drive heads. (S&P) (Stifel)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) +19.3% premarket as Maxim Group begins coverage with a...

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) +19.3% premarket as Maxim Group begins coverage with a Buy rating and an $18 price target. The firm says IMUC has the potential to create a new, innovative second-generation dendritic cancer vaccine to address perceived shortfalls of Dendreon's (NASDAQ:DNDN) Provenge. If successful, the firm thinks it could become a billion-dollar product.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 5 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) jet up 6.1% premarket as word spreads that Eddie is a buyer....

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) jet up 6.1% premarket as word spreads that Eddie is a buyer. ValueWalk sees an even bigger tailwind for the company, as Sears credit rating and debt load continues to show solid improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 8 Comments
  • FRAN

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) catches an upgrade from Avondale to Outperform due to...

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) catches an upgrade from Avondale to Outperform due to attractive valuation and growth potential. Shares of FRAN +1.5% premarket, +28% over the last three months off of the firm's strong financial results compared to retail rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • WWW

    Shares of Wolverine World Wide (NYSE:WWW) slump 6.0% premarket after the company tips off in...

    Shares of Wolverine World Wide (NYSE:WWW) slump 6.0% premarket after the company tips off in comments made at the Piper Jaffray Consumer Conference that it sees Q3 EPS and revenue coming in below the expectations of analysts. Management says retailers are taking a conservative buying approach in the U.S. and weak sales in Europe are also dragging down results. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • EU shares and U.S. stock futures stay firmly positive as Mario Draghi outlines the details of...

    EU shares and U.S. stock futures stay firmly positive as Mario Draghi outlines the details of the ECB's widely expected bond-buying program, with the S&P Benchmark +0.6%. American Realty Capital Trust jumps 8.1% on news it's being bought by Realty Income (+3.9%), while engine maker Navistar purrs 8.4% following earnings, but VeriFone sinks 10.8% after its report. Later: ISM Non-Manufacturing Index, Quarterly Services Report

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • MRGE

    Merge Healthcare (NASDAQ:MRGE) +17.3% premarket after announcing its intention to explore...

    Merge Healthcare (NASDAQ:MRGE) +17.3% premarket after announcing its intention to explore strategic alternatives including a potential sale of the company or a business combination.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • IMUC
